body:
It's possibly to do in pure Python. You can "skip" layers in forward prop by using tf.cond to decide which layer is used as an input to given layer.

You can do even more advanced things without leaving Python-land, ie, you can forward prop through some layers, and backprop through a different set of layers. 
To skip layers for backprop, the basic trick is to use [stop_gradient ](http://stackoverflow.com/a/36480182/419116) to control which implementation is used for backprop run. Here's another [example](https://github.com/yaroslavvb/stuff/blob/master/conditional_backprop.py)
